title: Re-introduce load-bearing assert, or fix niche debuginfo generation properly.

labels.name: A-debuginfo
labels.description: Area: Debugging information in compiled programs (DWARF, PDB, etc.)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/55701#discussion_r270227197, this is just one-line addition for the assert.

Currently, this example:
```rust
#![feature(repr128)]

#[repr(u128)]
pub enum Foo {
    Lo,
    Hi = 1 << 64,
    Bar = 18_446_745_000_000_000_123,
}

pub fn foo() -> Option<Foo> {
    None
}
```
has this in its LLVM IR (in debug mode):
```llvm
!22 = !DIDerivedType(tag: DW_TAG_member, name: "None", scope: !20, file: !6, baseType: !23, size: 128, align: 64, extraData: i64 926290448508)
```
Note the `extraData`, which indicates the discriminant (niche, in this case), it should be the same value as `Foo::Bar`, plus `1`, but is instead the truncated value (see below).

The debuginfo for `Foo` is also wrong, but that is caused elsewhere in the codebase (in a spot where no assertion was ever added AFAIK. also see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/59509#issuecomment-478128182):
```llvm
!10 = !DIEnumerator(name: "Lo", value: 0)
!11 = !DIEnumerator(name: "Hi", value: 0)
!12 = !DIEnumerator(name: "Bar", value: 926290448507)
```

The compiler should ICE, instead, to avoid generating the wrong debuginfo.

<hr/>

Alternatively, if LLVM and DWARF support it, we should encode the 128-bit discriminant, by employing `const_uint_big` instead of `const_u64` here:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/237bf3244fffef501cf37d4bda00e1fce3fcfb46/src/librustc_codegen_llvm/debuginfo/metadata.rs#L1817 
Also, this field would need to become `Option<u128>`:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/237bf3244fffef501cf37d4bda00e1fce3fcfb46/src/librustc_codegen_llvm/debuginfo/metadata.rs#L924
